column1: The  Petitioner  Company  also  contends  that  according  to  Section  171  of  the  Inland
Revenue Act, No. 10 of 2006 (as amended), an agreement reached only during an appeal
stage hearing is final and conclusive and cannot be overturned. However, this Court is
of  the  view  that  the  Inland  Revenue Act  does  not  expressly  prohibit  the  IRD  from
reaching settlements with the taxpayers at a stage other than the appeal stage. It is an
accepted fact that in procedural law what is not forbidden is permissible in law.5
